course.subject: LANG
course.name: English for Science I
course.description: An English course for students of the School of Science. The course introduces students to the language and discourse of science and develops their competence in speaking and writing about scientific topics.
course.prerequisites: LANG 1403 OR LANG 1404 OR LANG 1003 (prior to 2022-23)

reviews.author: Hibah
reviews.comment_content:
The following tasks were assigned to students:

- A 3-minute individual presentation where you explain a scientific concept in plain English to people who do not have a science background.
- A 9-12 minutes problem analysis group presentation on a natural disaster of your choice with Q&A.
- A 1200-1500 word individual essay to recommend a solution to the negative impact of the natural disaster case study project.
- An individual video to reflect on what you learned from the case study project.
reviews.comment_teaching: I think the instructor was quite helpful when it came to answering questions about each task. She also assisted my group in determining if our natural disaster topic was appropriate or not. Overall, I was satisfied with her teaching style.
reviews.comment_grading: I believe the grading was done well. I received an A as my final grade and the feedback that I got for each task seemed to align with my own thoughts about my work.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was like any other LANG course and pretty manageable. I never felt like there was too much work that needed to be done and I think the course requires you to spend an apt amount of time for the number of credits.

(If you don't know this meme just simply skip this)
=======================================

Erm, the content, I would say, is totally not related science at all. I believe I am more like taking a course related to engineering. I should quit science school and go to study CIVL after taking this course.

The course can be divided into 2 main parts:

1. SIPE (Science In Plain English)
What do you have to do? Prepare some props and demonstrate some science knowledge to general audiences. How old? Around 15 maybe.

2. Natural Disasters
Come on! This course is called English for Science. But in the end I feel more like I am doing something related to engineering.

You are required to analysize an natural disaster in a scientific way. So you know what it will be ended up, which is, engineering related stuff.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Great LANG instructor teaching. (Same as Ivan Yung (Unfortunately he went to CUHK) and Sumie)

Thomas is a nice instructor. He can engage the atmosphere of the lecture and make the lecture not boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
Let me tell you a secret:

Grading in LANG is very clear and transparent, just like the diamond sold in the jewelry shop that everyone believes they deserve that grade.

Unfortunately the secret is false :(

On 23/5, CLE department throw me 3 emails at once, telling me the grade for all the tasks are released. I thanked my instructor for working so hard these days for marking all the assignments done in this semester, including SIPE and individual report.

I suddenly remembered Yan Min, who also release all the score few days after the final exam. I suspect Yan Min also took few days after final to mark all the midterm and final paper. However, considering that Yan Min leaves his office at 6 o'clock exactly, I believe this is impossible.

Anyway, when I open the CLE's potato-server hosted webpage that takes at least 1 minutes to load, I see the following grade:

SIPE: 5 5 5
Interim Presentation: 5 5 5.5
Individual Recommendation Report: 4.5 4.5 5

Then I got a B. Not bad grade but still not good grade at all.

Still, I would like to thank my instructor for his effort in marking all assignments. That's it. After LANG3021 I will no longer need any LANG courses. Thankfully it will not be counted in MCGA or I'll be f**ked up.
reviews.comment_workload:
Errrm is this part necessary for you?

I mean, every science students have to take the course. You have no choice right (Other than DSCT, you can also choose LANG2030(H)).

Let me give you some preperation. The workload is quite large. In the 3 months you need to do a 3-min video and a individual report around 1500 words. ChatGPT is allowed but considered the fact that it gave me bullsh*t, I consider not using this tool for my assignment.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Ms. Tess give a chill atmosphere while attending her lessons. Sometimes, she would share hear own travel, singing and dancing experiences, sometimes if we had free time, she would play some bossnova songs or show a dance video to relax our heavy workload.

For lessons, she would make good instructions and give examples on how to ace this course with higher grades examples. Besides, she would separate 2 groups of people attending 1 of the lesson or consultation period when the assignment due date is come.

reviews.comment_workload:
This course has a quite heavy workload. First, you have to prepare a 3-min video presentation on a scientific concept, how to deliver the concept in an intresting way is very crucial.

Another main assignment is the group project on studing natural hazards and how to give a possible solution to solve the problem. You have to form in groups, choosing 1 natural hazard, and finish the problem analysis first. Then, you have to work with your groupmates to finish the powerpoint, and give a 15 minute interim presentation. Finally, you have to write a recommendation report based on what you have done (at least 1200-1500 words), if you attended library workshop, this may help you find sources and cite sources for this project.

Therefore, the workload is very tough unless you find a study platform or a partner to help for your work

reviews.comment_teaching:
Thomas is the best lang instructor I have ever met. He engages the class in the discussion. Be active in class to answer his questions then you should be clear that what he wants for the submitted tasks.

In SIPE, he gave me constructive comments and I followed his instructions and managed to get high marks. This is good because if you really follow his instruction, it is guaranteed to get high marks. He gave marks objectively and reasonably.

For the group projects, he gave clear instructions and freedom that he doesn't mind if your presentation exceeded time a bit. He won't stop you from speaking so you dun need to worry about the time limit, which makes me perform better.

For the recommendation report, he also gave us more freedom that we can write 1700 words at maximum. It was stated in the task sheet that we can't write more than 1500 words. But i think he knew it's very easy to exceed words so he gave more freedom. You can sense that he is a logical person. He wants you to be evidence-based and specific enough. If you are able to do so in your report, you can score high definitely.
reviews.comment_grading:
My Grades:

SIPE: 7/ 6.5 / 6.5

Group projects: 7/ 6.5 / 6.5

Recommendation report: 6.5 / 6.5 / 7

Final Grade: A+

The first time to get an A range in Lang and an unexpected grade (really feel surprised), I didn't get any A range in the year 1 Lang course for your reference.

Thank You, Thomas !!!
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is a bit heavy. I spend a lot of time on all tasks. The first task of SIPE is a pre-recorded individual presentation. I spend the whole day recording a 3 min presentation. The second task is group projects on natural disasters, you must find good and collaborative groupmates in order to perform well. I am lucky to find good groupmates with that we all participated (no free-riders)
The final task is the recommendation report. Make sure you write it specifically and evidence-based.

reviews.author: WHangHo
reviews.comment_content:
The main purpose of this course is to equip students with ability to explain the complicated science knowledge in interesting and easy to understand ways.

There was one assignment that required students to have video recording to introduce a science knowledge. The topic was decided by ourselves.

The other one was about the natural disasters. Students needed to form a group of 3-5 people to choose a natural disaster from the list provided and propose science solutions to deal with the natural disasters. An additional related individual writing task was required after the presentation.

reviews.author: Phil7
reviews.title: Acceptable
reviews.comment_content:
All about natural disasters and u will learn how to deliver science in plain English.

The course is quite easy actually.

You'll need to prepare a speech about 3 to 4 minutes to deliver a science knowledge in an interesting way by the beginning of October.

You need to group with two people and make a 3 people team to work on one type of specific natural disaster. For my team we are dealing with the Argentina locust infestation. You need to prepare a PowerPoint and present it together with your team mate on your progress on this natural disaster by the beginning of the November.

The last assignment is to write a report on that natural disaster with solutions.

Cause they will work with u in that presentation.

So it is important to pick a good teammate since it is voluntary to choose.

I have good teammate and spend some time and get into A range.üòä

Its grade is better than my LANG1002/1003 courses.üò£

reviews.author: ilubyouboyz
reviews.title: Grade indirectly proportional to effort
reviews.comment_content:
This course wants you to learn about Science in Plain English (SIPE), which you need to explain a scientific concept in plain English, like using fewer jargons and more simple words and similes.

Another major topic to learn is writing a recommendation report, which you write with evidence and reasonings to persuade the readers that your recommendation is the best one and to choose your suggestion. In this topic, you will learn to do a progress report presentation too.
reviews.comment_teaching: There were definitely new stuffs, like the recommendation report, it was new to me. However, I feel like it's a waste of time that my tutor spent a couple of lessons teaching the presentation skills that primary school students should know, such as how to make visual aids and make them attractive, as well as presentation etiquette.
reviews.comment_grading:
Video presentation in SIPE (20%): 6.5 5 5

Recommendation report (35%): 4.5 5 5

Overall B-
Referring to my friends' marks and grades, guess I got the cutoff mark of B- grade of my class, if the grading was really depending on the marks I got in the submitted works.
reviews.comment_workload: It was fine to me, LANG1002 and 1003 had more workload than 2010. That's why I felt quite ok about the assignments and deadlines. The pre-unit quizzes basically didn't count the actual score but just as long as you submit it will be fine. Each pre-unit quiz just needed 3-8 mins to finish.

like every LANG course, attendance is required, so don't miss the class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Liza is a very nice person. She would have share some interesting thing with us at the beginning of the lesson to make us be more relax. Like the interesting things about her dogs. She is also passionate in teaching and willing to answer our questions. During the class, she would encourage us to express our ideas. Which I think it is good, providing a chance to let us chat in English.

Liza is also willing to listen our concern regarding the assignment. Say the SIPE assignment, she hope us can complete the script before the due day. So that she can have a look at the content, and give us some feedback that whether we are off the track or not. She will try her best to answer your concern.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think the grading is fair, as long as you work hard and finish the task on time. You might get an acceptable grading. Just like LANG 1003. For me, I would say Liza grading was so lenient than I expected.

For reference:
SIPE 5.5/5.5/5.5
Group progress report presentation 5.5/5.5/6
Individual recommendation report 5/5.5/5
With a letter grade B+
I finish the recommendation report in 2 day because for me writing an academic essay was a disaster. So my mark in the last assignment was significantly lower than the other.
reviews.comment_workload:
I think the workload is acceptable. Before each lesson, there will be a pre-unit task to let you have a brief idea about what is going to teach in the lesson.
Through out the course, pre-unit task each lesson. 3 task, 2 are individual, 1 is group work. I think this is fair for an LANG course.

reviews.author: Look A squirrel
reviews.title: Great Course.......for future Sci Fi writers with a lot of time on their hand
reviews.comment_content:
If I could, I would tell people to not take this course but this option is not available for the unlucky victims in the school of Science

As many has stated before, the instructor has neither a scientific background nor any relevant knowledge

No useful information can be gleamed from the curse (It‚Äôs a typo but I see no need in fixing it), and I‚Äôm saying this as someone who will begrudgingly admit that LANG 1002 and 1003 have taught useful skills for the future, though they are a waste of time. They supposed purpose of the course is to teach you how to communicate science to the public which it tried teaching in some way but not effectively, some course contents are scientifically questionable, especially using a video from the Union of Concerned Scientists, a well known anti-GMO advocacy group, related to GMO, despite the organisation being well known for being against the scientific consensus about GMO. The course also limits the solution provided for the recommendation report for a natural disaster to be ‚Äúscientific‚Äù, in reality they mean science-ish, it is a great practice for aspiring science fiction writers, who wish to have their story based on hardish science. Never in my life have I become so disgusted at the word ‚Äúscientific‚Äù being spoken out of a human mouth. I‚Äôve put so many buzzwords in my report, some clueless billionaires reading will be planning to invest in the BS I came up with.

(-100)/10, if there was a way to not take this course and still graduate, this course will have no enrolment
reviews.comment_teaching: Given the absolute trainwreck of a course this is, Anita did a pretty decent job teaching the language concepts that is in the course, even though any new contents are completely useless outside of the course. The advice provided in discussions (both in class and 1 on 1 consultations) are genuinely useful for improving my writing. There are also an abundance of group discussions in breakout room that we can use to discuss with group mate how much of a s***show the course is, other courses and just plain chitchat, if it wasn‚Äôt for the amount of time required for the course or the abysmally awful content, the course may have been enjoyable
reviews.comment_grading:
At least in my opinion, the grading was fair if not a little tough. My SPIE (Science In Plain English) recorded short speech is admittedly not my best work, and the mark reflected that, though having background noises are unavoidable if your family members just insist on sorting out the 10 million plastic bags in the living room while you are recording instead of just shutting up and waited for like 20 minutes and your room is unavailable because your idiot of a brother fell of a motorcycle and had to get stitches on his right arm and leg, and there are no other available room in the house. (I think I‚Äôve gone on a tangent here but I‚Äôm to lazy to fix this).

The report on the other hand was a masterpiece of complete and utter BS, no more meaningless words have been cobbled together to create something that looks so amazing yet is totally devoid of any real or practical solutions, if you have even a speck of relevant knowledge, you will either be laughing your a** off or facepalmming at such a thing existing. One of the references was an article with the word ‚Äúshit‚Äù in the title, referring to actual feces, the data from that article did not add much useful information and can be found elsewhere easily but where is the fun in that? Did I spend way to much time on a joke that no one will notice? Yes. Was it worth it? Absolutely, after all, the summary of the course‚Äôs quality can be found in a word in the title of a reference from a report of a student.

The best part is that the report earned a relatively high mark as while the actual ‚Äúscientific‚Äù contents are questionable (not that the instructor would notice, see the content section and multiple other reviews), the language and grammar was to a relatively high standard, a standard that is befitting of a person who took English Language & Literature for his A Levels as his ‚Äúfun‚Äù elective.
reviews.comment_workload: Despite the aforementioned lack of substance in course content, the workload is unreasonably high, high enough that it may interfere with the time you need to study other lectures, especially if you are the kind of person whose ADHD would lead you to Alpha Centauri and back when researching something or spend an ungodly amount of time for one stupid little joke (the emphasis is on the little) that no one will ever notice if they aren‚Äôt actively looking for it. The SPIE took some work while the report requires a lot of research even when just half a**ing it for a decent grade. In all honesty, if I failed any of my actual course, this course is responsible.

reviews.author: Kengorgor
reviews.comment_content:
It is a three-credit course offered to second-year undergraduates of the School of Science. Over one term, students will attend three hours of class, and will be expected to complete up to six hours of out-of-class work per week. It is an integrated skills course utilizing the problem-based case study concept to assist and enhance the development of students‚Äô confidence and competence in language, communication and general life skills.

The course aims to develop students‚Äô ability to deliver presentations and take part in discussions on topics relevant to their field of study. It also aims to enhance their ability to read and write about science-related topics, combining the use of sources with their own ideas. Language work focuses on developing the vocabulary, language structures, writing and speaking skills which will allow students to fulfil these aims.

LANG 1002 and LANG 1003 are pre-requisites for this course.

reviews.author: SA_1007
reviews.title: Very easy to get an A but heavy workload. Be warned!
reviews.comment_content: The main idea was to learn how to communicate scientific information with the general public, meaning those without any scientific background. The instructors are language specialists who may or may not have in depth scientific  knowledge, at least my professor didn't and it is what he explained in class. First half of the course was about general techniques of conveying knowledge as well as persuading them to take action towards an issue which is the second half.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is really funny and chilled person. You will be fond of him if do not like strict professors. Best part is that he is rather lenient in his marking. If you do not want your Mark's to be reduced heavily after the consultation between other language teachers, I suggest you work hard to get top ranges such as 6/7.

I got A from him at the end, I got full marks in the first two assignments and close to full range in the last 2.
reviews.comment_grading:
The first assignment was a short speech presentation as a preparation for a science competition. It about presenting a science topic of any sort to a large crowd whilst making it interesting.

# tip is to speak like those in TED talk (one great source of reference), and talk naturally and not like a robot!.

The second one is selecting a natural disaster and writing up a proposal to call for immediate action to prevent casualties.
This is the assignment I got full Mark's.
##HINT: do pick a easy disaster supported by solid scientific backup.

As for the third and the fourth is a group presentation followed by a complete report on the presentation.
# To get high mark do find proper research to back up your points without copying. Best way to avoid plagiarism is to use the skill of converting difficult science facts into easy messages, aka, use easier words in your speech and report. For the report do use synonyms if you cannot find any other way to explain the stuff.

I got A from him at the end, I got full marks in the first two assignments and close to full range in the last 2.
reviews.comment_workload:
4 assignments, but the effort put into them isn't low, especially for those aiming for A or above. Honestly it will take time as the presentation requires practice and the report is fairly lengthy. Especially the second final report requires literature reviewing.

So don't take this course too lightly ;P !

reviews.author: michaeltcf
reviews.title: Very good grade course!
reviews.comment_content:
LANG 2010, English for Science 1, is a three-credit course offered to second-year undergraduates of the School of Science. Over one term, students will attend three hours of class, and will be expected to complete up to six hours of out-of-class work per week. It is an integrated skills course utilizing the problem-based case study concept to assist and enhance the development of students‚Äô confidence and competence in language, communication and general life skills.

The course aims to develop students‚Äô ability to deliver presentations and take part in discussions on topics relevant to their field of study. It also aims to enhance their ability to read and write about science-related topics, combining the use of sources with their own ideas. Language work focuses on developing the vocabulary, language structures, writing and speaking skills which will allow students to fulfil these aims.
reviews.comment_teaching: It really depends on which professor. My teacher is fun and I have great "LANG mates" as well. We all have a lot of fun and most of us attend every lectures as well.
reviews.comment_grading:
Of course, you cannot miss more than 5 lessons. And the grading assessments include an oral presentation (15%) , a proposal writing (20%) and lastly, a group project include writing a report (25%) and a presentation (30%) as well. Also, there are participation marks (5%) as well.

In my class, as far as I know most students were given good grades. I got full marks in the proposal writing, only one mark deducted in the oral presentation, and only decent marks (some 7s, not all 7s) in my final group project. I got an A.
reviews.comment_workload: At first, you may find the course pretty hard. The assignments filled up your semester and you will find no time resting in the lessons. If you have good LANG mates and make some friends, you will find the lessons more joyful. Basically when you finish your oral presentation, you immediately are going to prepare for your proposal.

reviews.author: Trevis@MATH
reviews.title: Common LANG course
reviews.comment_content:
LANG 2010, English for Science 1, is a three-credit course offered to second-year undergraduates of the School of Science. Over one term, students will attend three hours of class, and will be expected to complete up to six hours of out-of-class work per week. It is an integrated skills course utilizing the problem-based case study concept to assist and enhance the development of students‚Äô confidence and competence in language, communication and general life skills.

The course aims to develop students‚Äô ability to deliver presentations and take part in discussions on topics relevant to their field of study. It also aims to enhance their ability to read and write about science-related topics, combining the use of sources with their own ideas. Language work focuses on developing the vocabulary, language structures, writing and speaking skills which will allow students to fulfil these aims.
reviews.comment_teaching: Nothing special just like normal LANG courses.
reviews.comment_grading:
In line with general University guidelines, the Center for Language Education‚Äôs official minimum attendance requirement for all LANG required courses is 80%. If a student misses 6 or more classes in each term, that student will fail the course and will have to retake the whole course.

Incremental warnings:
After missing 3 classes (in total i.e. not consecutive), a warning letter will be sent to the student, copied to his or her department. After missing 6 lessons, the student fails the course. A letter will be sent to the student, his or her department and a notification to the ARRO.
Permission to take leave will be given only where prolonged absence is unavoidable, in cases where students have suffered serious illness or injury, on production of documentary evidence.

Participation (5%): Weeks 1 to 13
„ÉªAttendance at the library workshop on research and referencing skills.
„ÉªInstructor evaluation of:
„Éª participation in online, in-class and other tasks,
   and preparation/preparedness before lessons
„Éª punctuality and lesson attendance
„Éª attitude.
reviews.comment_workload:
An individual speaking task (15%): Week 4 and/or Week 5
„Éª3 minutes (without visual aids);
„ÉªIndividual work;
„ÉªPresent a scientific concept in plain English.

An individual case study project proposal (20%): Week 8
„Éª500 - 600 words;
„ÉªIndividual work;
„ÉªPropose a research related to a natural disaster case.

A group case study presentation (30%): Week 13
„Éª15 minutes + 4 minutes Q&A session (with visual aids);
„ÉªGroup work;
„ÉªPresent a case with solutions and recommendations for problem identified.

A group case study report (25%): Week 14
„Éª2000 - 2500 words;
„ÉªGroup work;
„ÉªPropose a case with solutions and recommendations for problem identified.

iPeer (5%): Week 14
„ÉªSelf and peer evaluation of group writing, speaking and online tasks.

reviews.author: biochemisttt
reviews.comment_content:
Science in plain English presentation (Individual)
Proposal (Individual)
Report (Group)
Report presentation (Group)

I think the content of the course is average. Topic of SIPE contest is chosen by your own. The thing u need to pay attention is u just need to explain the concept to dummy and u do it fluently and confidently, then u can get a good mark in SIPE.
For the proposal part, u need to choose one natural disaster and explains for the solutions scientifically. This examines your skills of explaining concepts to dummies very much as those solutions can be very complicated. Also, it examines your critical thinking. How to balance the pros and cons of each solutions and choosing the criteria of dealing with the natural disaster. I do think the case study part did examine lots of your integrated skills.
reviews.comment_teaching: I like Liza. She looks old but she loves to interact with us. She even introduces her instagram to us and asked us to follow. I did improve much on my presentation skills as I was chosen by her to be one of the finalist in the SIPE contest. You better ask for her comments personally for specific comments or recommendations as her comments on the grading system would be very general. She studied Life Science for her degree and the whole class is studying Life Science so we can talk without boundaries.
reviews.comment_grading:
I did the best in SIPE for 6s and 7s
those reports and presentations got 5s and 6s
Escape for 4-5 lessons and eventually got B+

However, if u dream for an A range in LANG 2010, I think u should choose an instructor that does not teach LANG 2010H. It is obvious for her comparison between our class and the H class ability everytime when talking about the grading. This comparison does not exist for the instructors not teaching H class and their students can get an A more easily!
Quite unfair to hear that those people with worse English ability than you having a better just because their instructors give marks loosely.
reviews.comment_workload:
A average language course with 4 assessments. Good luck when choosing your groupmates.

Please pay attention: if the instructor chose u to represent the class to be a finalist in the SIPE contest held in lt-A, it is OPTIONAL. I was attracted by the prizes and was one of the finalist. However, u would realize the gap of u and those in LANG 2010H. Put more time on studying of other midterm would be more useful instead. Being one of the finalist in SIPE won't make your final grade higher whereas not being a finalist still can get an A range.

reviews.author: gazelle
reviews.comment_content: Language skills useful for further study are taught in the course. You will learn the presentation skills and report-writing skills that you will find useful when doing your FYP later. Plus, the instructor will also teach you how to think critically and analyze comprehensively on an issue. It is far deeper than what were taught in LANG 1002/3.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Amy's teaching is praiseworthy because every lesson you will gain valuable experience from her, be they the sharing of her own experience or her way of viewing the world. I can see her passion and experience in teaching language courses. In spite of her tight schedule (she has 10 lessons per week), every time she is well prepared for the lesson.

Yet, I found the instructions of assignments unclear. Although there is a "detailed" marking scheme for every assignment, they are just "cliche" giving us meaningless information. We have to guess what the instructor wants by listening to his/ her explanations and asking for some follow-up clarifications. At the end of the day, it is the instructor himself/ herself who sets the marking criteria and gives out the scores.

Another thing that makes no sense is the samples provided. Sometimes, I realized that our own performance is better than that of the sample(s) provided. For example, the sample group report was unsatisfying in terms of task achievement and organization (yet according to Amy, it already deserves some 5s & 6s). If I followed the way of the sample , I would have fallen into B range!!!

Year 2 or above lang is perceived to be Áàõgrade in nature because instructors generally hand out scores of assignments and course grade far stricter than in 1002/3. This is especially true when determining A range students. Rumor has it that Amy is one of the killers in LANG 2010. This not the real case when my assessment results are consistent with my prediction. (Yet failing to get an A grade is a regret to me.) In fact, the real killer is in H class. A friend of mine in H class who got higher score than me for the two group projects eventually ended up a B+.
reviews.comment_workload: I would say the amount of workload depends largely on your goal. If you only aim at a C range, then you could simply 9 do every assignment and you will find the workload quite light. But if you aim high or you are a perfectionist like me, then you will find every assignment time-consuming. This is especially the case for the two group projects.

reviews.author: Lu
reviews.title: Poor preparation. Teaches useless things. Subjective marking.
reviews.comment_content: Normal workload but beware of free riders. He will not help you to solve free-riding problem or even be lenient to the groups who have free-riders.
reviews.comment_teaching: He used all his time to teach useless grammar. There was little demo before submitting the assessments but they were all useless.
reviews.comment_grading: Cannot how to tell how he gives out his so-called fair, according to marking criteria, marks. So subjective and rubbish.
reviews.comment_workload: No extra workload from this guy. But there are originally quite a lot to do in this cours already.

reviews.comment_content:

3 mins

reviews.comment_teaching:
Quite good.
Good learning atmosphere.
Computers are allowed (or even recommended) to retrieve learning materials from the canvas.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading of the speaking task is quite good but that of the proposal is strict (may be I don't know what it requires in the proposal)
reviews.comment_workload:

reviews.author: zlong
reviews.comment_content:
Different from Lang1000 courses, this course does not require a textbook. All the content is from Canvas. I appreciate that because the 1000 Level Lang book was kinda useless.
The first task (SIPE) you have to do is explaining a scientific concept in simple English. The instructor will comment on your choice of words and delivery skills.
The second part of the class, you have to think of a natural disaster (definition: disasters that are not caused by human factors), then write an essay, do presentation and write a report about that disaster.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Liza is a nice lady and her lessons were not boring. She explained the marking criteria somewhat clearly.
However, the feedback of each task was not given right after the assessment. You cannot improve your performance (especially for the presentation) because you will not get your marks till final examination period.
The comments that Liza gave to the individual proposal and study report were very general, compared to other tutors. My friend and I received same comment (We think she "copy and paste"ed the comment).
reviews.comment_grading:
15% - Individual presentation task (3 minutes)
20% - Individual case study proposal (500-600 words)
25% - Group presentation (15 minutes, with 4 minutes Q&A)
30% - Group case study report (2000-2500 words)
5% - Peer evaluation
5% - Participation

I got average 21-22 out of 28 marks for all the tasks and I attended all the lessons. I get an A-.
reviews.comment_workload:
As the tasks are related to each other, the workload is smaller than what I imagined. As long as you choose a "good" natural disaster, you will not have any difficulties in doing the later tasks.
I would suggest finding group mates with similar major so that you can cooperate better and work more effectively.

reviews.title: Good grade but huge workload
reviews.comment_content:
Task-based course about natural disaster

Science in plain English presentation (Individual)
Proposal (Individual)
Report (Group)
Report presentation (Group)

The content is really wired, we have to recommend effective SCIENTIFIC solution to natural disaster but if the solution is really effective, then the world has used it already, why still need you to recommend???
reviews.comment_teaching:
Jessie is a very nice instructor and explains every thing very clear, including what we are expected from the accessed tasks and reminds us a lot of things that we may make mistake of.

She is also really considerable. During midterm exam period, she has organized a blend-learning lesson, allowing us no need to come to attend class in person.
reviews.comment_grading:
Very good grade

Perhaps she has helped us to check everything before the 'real' submission, so we an get a lot of 6 or 7 in most categories
reviews.comment_workload:
Jessie recommends us to hand in our draft for her to take a look and she will give comments on where can we improve and whether there is gap in our content. Thus, compared to other classes, her class almost have double workload and very tight deadline.

But it deserves

reviews.author: Êï∏Â≠∏Á†îÁ©∂Áîü
reviews.title: Very Easy Subject
reviews.comment_content:
It's mainly talk about how to write a report or personal proposal in your future life in a scientific way. By comparing to the previous language courses, it's easy for students to understand what do you need to do to obtain a good grade or simply how to write a formal proposal to your boss.

Mainly focus on Natural Disasters and how can you help to convince those problems as a scientist.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I think Carmel is a nice person and funny teacher. You will enjoy every lectures. Carmel tries to make sure everybody knows what's going on and every time if there are any assignments, she will discuss the marking criteria in the class, it ;s very important to know how to get a higher grade.

She divides us into many groups and discuss some topics about natural disasters. Since you need to know ehat you are going to write in your proposals and reports.

Try not to miss the class and come to the class on time, since I know that Carmel will record the time that you come to the class, I think she may deduct some marks from participation.
reviews.comment_grading:
I don't like the grading. Although I got the highest grade by comparing to my previous language subjects. I think my instructor can push me at least one more sub-grade. Since I do think I did really well and I put a lot of effort on it.

Personal Proposal (Almost 6)
Personal Presentation (Almost 6)
Group Report (Some 5, 6)
Group Presentation( ALL of the team members have to give a presentation in class) (Almost 6)

I got almost all 6 but only get a B+. But I know that my instructor is one of the killers, I can get a B+ from her is not that easy.
reviews.comment_workload:
It's quite relax at the beginning of the class. But you may feel tired after or in the middle of the class. Since my lessons started at 9 am, I had to wake up early and came to the campus.

I used around 3-4 hours to finish my personal proposal. Some people used 2 days to finish it. You can compare the workload by yourself.

reviews.author: Kui
reviews.comment_content:
all the lessons teach you how to write your assignment
how to find a topic and make a plan for finish it
how to select appropriate information for your essay
and how to present in a appropriate manner
sounds like broing
but amy make it quite interesting
reviews.comment_teaching:
Interesting teaching
relaxing atmosphere
She taught us how to think critically
reviews.comment_grading:
unexpected, because many people say amy is a killer
Finally got B+, but i got 2 c range in lang 1002 and lang 1003
reviews.comment_workload:
moderate, 3 of them are related
1 individual presentation (3 mins)
1 individual report (600 words)
1 group report (2500 words)
1 group presentation (15mins)

reviews.author: chl
reviews.comment_content: Students have to choose one natural disaster to discuss and give scientific solutions to solve.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very Bad! The lessons are extremely boring. She explains the assessments unclear and always bans our suggestions. As a UG student, I think it is difficult to suggest some perfect scientific and innovative solutions to solve the natural disasters. If I can choose once again, i would drop the course and choose another tutors in spring semester.
reviews.comment_grading:
Poor Grading. She gives us low mark in all assessments compared to other classes. It is not easy to get high marks from her. Our suggested solutions need to be scientific and innovative. Although she said the solution no need to be brand new, when she commented on my essay, she wrote my suggested solution are existed and are not scientific enough.

Since she gave us low mark in the assessments, the grade is poor! I would prefer drop the course if I cant swap to the other lessons and study in the next semester.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 4 assignments: around 500 words Individual Writing, Individual Presentation, around 800 words Group Essay and Group Presentation.

reviews.author: Kabul
reviews.title: Lenient grading.
reviews.comment_content:
The tasks are mostly related to disaster risk reduction methodologies. We're expected to pick a natural disaster (tsunami, earthquake, hurricane, epidemic, or whatever...), analyze its cause, propose viable solutions and justify them. Just pick solutions related to your major if you want a better life.

In my opinion this course is quite biased towards life science students. In the SIPE contest an overwhelming majority of the finalists were in life science majors, and all of them talked on topics related to life science.
reviews.comment_teaching: Jessie is a phenomenal tutor. She's great in explaining what we're expected in the tasks, how we can better organize our ideas in the essays, and how we can deliver ideas better in the presentations. reviews.title: UST need to stop forcing ppl to take all these trash bad grade course
reviews.comment_content:
Trash.

Although this course is called "English for Science", ironically, chances are your instructor will not even have a science background or even care about science at all. As a result, the objectives of the course are really vague. While it seems like that the main theme of the course is to teach you how to communicate with the general public about science, you're asked to write something in a more technical setting, but you would get criticized if you write something too technical that the instructor cannot understand (WTF?). And honestly I don't see the point of the course, I had taken like some 10 years of English classes just to learn how to communicate with the general public, I don't need another course to teach me the same thing just on a different setting. I was expecting the content of the course to be something more intellectual, like how to communicate with other experts as a SCIENTIST, but not how to tell good science story to a random person on the street, like the course instructor.

Honestly, I have learnt nothing from the course. The whole course design is so centered on the final group project. So instead of trying to improve your writing and presentation skills, the focus of its content is literally on how to score high on the assessments. So I paid my $42,100 to get educated, and now you're saying that I have to take a course just for the sake of passing it? What a waste of time.

Occasionally, there would be lessons trying to teach you some writing skill, but they are in general lacking in depth and are really of no uses. Though the course won't bother to really try to improve your English, your "performance" and grade in the course are solely assessed based on your English proficiency. C'mon UST, I already have my secondary school exams, LANG1002 and LANG1003 to tell me how bad I'm in English; I really don't need another course to tell me that again. It is ENOUGH.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Colin is a nice guy. At least he doesn't run the class in a secondary school style, which many local instructors loved to, and make the classroom has a somewhat relaxed atmosphere.

Beware though, he seems to have really high standards and very strict grading (please see "grading").
reviews.comment_grading:
From my impression, the grading of LANG2010 is even worse than LANG1002, LANG1003.

I had unfortunately had a killer instructor back in LANG1002, but I still managed to get a B+ at the end, and I had gotten a A- for LANG1003. But I only got a B for this course, even though I had spend almost 3 times as much effort on it as compared to 1002 and 1003.

The grading has zero transparency. I still have no idea exactly what scores I got for the assessments.

Only the score for the first writing task is released. And I scored quite poorly on that one (4's and 5's) because I didn't follow strictly on the "suggested structure" of the assessment, even though I have addressed all the different parts of the task. The grading is unexpectedly strict; literally every single spelling mistake counts (I had been criticized for a typo). I guess there is again that "impressionism" thing in the grading of all these LANG course. If you scored low on one of the grading criteria, chances are you would score bad on all of them, unless you are really good. Be sure to triple check with the rubric before submitting.
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite a lot.

You had to submit two vocabulary lists on week4 and week 11. The vocab lists are really useless but extremely time-consuming. Then on week 7 you need to make a 5-min presentation about how that vocab list shit helped you learn new vocab (Ikr, wtf.)

Then there is a individual writing task, a group presentation and a group writing task.

The individual is only about 500 words, but it is due in some of your busiest days during the midterm period.

The group project would take you quite a lot of time to prepare and complete, unless you are really good in English. I myself had spent almost the whole last three weeks in the semester doing nothing but this shit.

But the sad truth is, your effort is not proportional to your grade. The more time you need to put on your project, the more likely you are will receive a bad grade at the end...because the whole point of the course is to remind you how bad is your English.

reviews.author: HK416
reviews.comment_content:
The course includes two assessed presentations and two assessed technical reports which requires you to follow a scenario. It teaches students how to present innovative scientific or engineering ideas and write those in an academic way. This session helps a lot in presentation skills but a little in writing. There will be also four vocabulary tests for assessment.

Apart from the graded materials, the course also provide you an opportunity to discuss in a seminar discussion which is not assessed, but may count towards participation in class ,depending on the instructor.
reviews.comment_teaching:
In early and most classes, she will discuss and guide you through several science fictions in different topics, which could be a boring and meaningless process. Also, she may requires students to come on time and do the homework for discussion. This would count towards the participation mark.

For the project, please make sure you get her understand your idea before the presentation by having a short meeting or a chat with her. This seriously affects you content mark in first presentation.
reviews.comment_grading:
first group presentation 15%
first technical report 15%
final group presentation 25%
final report 25%
Vocabulary tests 15%
Participation 5%

First tip is to follow those specific requirements for the report. Those are easy to follow while any missing will seriously lower you grade of the report.
Secondly, the instructor is said to be a killer, giving some Ds in lang 100X (dunno which course, either 1002 or 1003). She said she followed the marking scheme as always. To be fair, she gave a 4 or 5 on average for your assessment. Though I had a few mistakes making me score a 3 in some parts, I still managed to get 7 and 6 in the last report and i get an A-, which, in my opinion, is fair. Generally, she also gave quite high marks to the others. Therefore, I will say show her how hard you work.
Thirdly, this course is to a certain extent about group work so make sure you get some responsible group mates.
reviews.comment_workload:
To have a good grade, basically, you need to at least secure the participation mark and vocabulary tests which are quite easy. Just try to answer some of her question. As to the presentation, hers advice was quite useful.
In general, the work load is fair. You will have a few pages of reading per week, four vocab test and a project.

reviews.author: Audrey
reviews.title: Interesting topic but not really good grade :(
reviews.comment_content:
Four units on topics of science (fiction), such as AI / space travel / evolution / ...The materials are quite interesting, since we are science students and most of us are passionate about science fiction stories :D
4 vocab test, two group pre3 & two individual report.
A lot of revision on grammar, quite helpful.
On the whole it is much more interesting than 1002/1003.
reviews.comment_teaching: Ka is very detail-oriented :) It's a good thing when he points out a hundred mistakes in your essay (many can be clarified if you talk to him) But your will find it very hard to get him to understand some scientific principles in your product presentation. A little stubborn. Good at teaching though, he would play movies or video clips from time to time (helpful in understanding the materials later).
reviews.comment_grading:
Sadly my worst grade till now. Maybe it's because I don't spend that much time and effort on LANG courses ==
Almost all vocab test full mark, group pre3 mostly 5/6, individual report around 5. Speak a lot in class. Got B+.(((
reviews.comment_workload: Said before, remember to rehearse the group presentation and think of possible questions from the audience. If you take Ka's class pay special attention to grammar and word choice. Good luck .
